result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

chargeModifiers.descr: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime

ADDRESS INFO for Jasmine M. Lariviere

Prior: 1183 Stiemke Lane, St Germain, WI 54558
No contact with co-defendant, Malik Isiah Jones/Must live in Oneida County 637 Moen St, Rhinelander, WI/Maintain employment

11:03 AM Defendant Jasmine M. Lariviere in court. Attorney Antoni Joseph Apollo appeared by video for Jasmine M. Lariviere. Prosecuting attorney Michael William Schiek in court for the State of Wisconsin. Court statement to motion filed - statement to last hearing date - Defendant could not appear. Court questions Defendant on why she was out of town. Apollo statement to motion Sowinski filed - statement to limited time to coordinate time to appear. Schiek states there is miss communication between his office and probation agent - probation does not want Defendant to live with grandmother - Schiek has no requirements - would like bond condition modified - will be up to PO. Court would like to hear from PO - cash bond was adjusted down. PO agent Lindsey Flynn in court - states does not want hre to live with grandmother - statement to where she was living. Court questions PO on approved housing. Flynn statement to address - must live in Oneida County. Apollo does not believe court should take action - no violations - would just like condition to live with grandmother removed - statement to Defendant's employment/counseling/visitation with child. Schiek agrees with Apollo/bond. Court will not agree that Defendant can live anywhere in Wisconsin - wants Defendant to live in Oneida County and be on a short leash - amends bond conditions. Apollo statement to possible transfer of PO. Court statement to transfer. Apollo would like to to accommodate move. Court give 24 hours to move. adj. 11:21 PM
Order on Joint Request for Bail/Bond Modification
Joint request for bail/bond modification
Motion hearing on October 21, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Motion hearing on October 18, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Motion hearing on October 18, 2022 at 01:00 pm. - Time of Hearing incorrect.  Amended Notice filed.
State's Motion to Modify Bond

11:31 AM Defendant Jasmine M. Lariviere in court. Attorney Antoni Joseph Apollo appeared by video for Jasmine M. Lariviere. Prosecuting attorney Mary M Sowinski in court for the State of Wisconsin. Calling 22CF205 & 22CF111. 22CF205 set for arraignment. Information has been filed that mirrors complaint. Apollo has received copy of information - waives further reading and enters not guilty pleas. Apollo will be filing motions - would like to set out 60 days. Apollo may appear by video at next appearance. Sowinski has complied with victim rights. Motions to be filed within 60 days. Bond continued. adj. 11:36 AM
Pre-trial conference scheduled for December 20, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

No contact with co-defendant, Malik Isiah Jones/Must continue treatment/Must live with grandmother Sandra Stiemke 1183 Stiemke Lane, St Germain, WI/Maintain employment (conditions modified - were not included on 9/19 bond)

01:26 PM Judge Mary Burns mentoring with Judge Gregory Grau. Defendant Jasmine M. Lariviere in court.  Attorney Antoni Joseph Apollo appeared by video for Jasmine M. Lariviere.  Attorney Michael William Schiek in court for State of Wisconsin. Schiek reviews cases. Apollo states Defendant waives preliminary hearing. Waiver free and voluntary. Apollo states has represented Defendant on other cases. Court finds that probable cause exists and binds over. Schiek statement to bond - would like a separate arraignment date. Apollo statement to Defendant's residence. Court questions Defendant on Grandmothers name/address/work hours. Apollo statement to other case - would like scheduled together. Court amends bond conditions. adj. 01:36 PM
Arraignment scheduled for October 11, 2022 at 11:30 am.
Letter to Judge re: initial appearance
Notified Scott, ONSO - Court quashes warrant/never sent over

2:05 PM Judge Mary Burns mentoring with Judge Neal Nielsen. Defendant Jasmine M. Lariviere appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Antoni Joseph Apollo appeared by video for Jasmine M. Lariviere.  Attorney Michael William Schiek in court for State of Wisconsin. In receipt of complaint. Apollo notes defendant waives her appearance in person; waives time limits for preliminary hearing/anticipates will be a waiver. Schiek/Apollo statement to bond. 2:16 p.m. off record. 2:18 p.m. back on record, same parties present. Court questions defendant on treatment/address/employment. Court statement to bond. Court quashes warrant. adj. 2:19 p.m.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for September 21, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
